ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: #2: Dr Lee is awonderful scientist and a wonderful teacher.#6/#10: In my opinion, this class covers too many topics at too superficial a level. Coming from a forestry perspective, I would like to see Dr Lee teach a course that covers just 3 topics rather than 20: an overview of some climatology basics (similar to what is included in this class), relationship of forests/vegetation and silvicultural treatments to climate/weather (microclimate amelioration, etc), and relationship of forests/vegetation to climate change (global view).

The class is not particularly related to my field of study, but there were a few very relevant lectures. Overall though, Professor Lee touched on many different topics of interest to students at FES through the lens of weather and climate, which was interesting.
The lecturer is very clear and tries hard to get everyone understand.
The weekly homework are the best way to understand what is taught in class
Dr Lee's enthusiasm and manner of interacting with students when they ask questions.
The variety of topics covered was the best part of the class so it appealed to students with various interests.
An interdisplinary approach to climate issues. Useful for understanding related policy and context.
Relevance topic to our current environmental problems

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Again, I think the course is too fragmented and covers too much - we all have pretty specialized interests at FES, and this courses is kind of a catch-all - would Dr Lee be willing to break it into two courses, one focused on relationship of climate to forestry, and one focused on...climate and energy? The climate and forestry one could also encompass aquatic systems - ocean acidification, release of CO2 from rivers, etc. I think splitting up the course would help enrollment too. Dr Lee is such a brilliant guy and great teacher, but as the courses is designed, too few students choose to take it.
N/A
Maybe pay more attension to possible policy implication?
More interaction with teacher-student dynamic in class

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: The TA and professor were both readily available to help and provided the needed assistance.
Insttructor and TA are very responsive.
Hgh avialiability and quality form Prof and TA

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: This course wasn't as relevant to my concentration, but there were still a few lectures in which I understood the mechanics of wind and solar energy, which are valuable to my education.
As science foundation of my knowledge to further research and work.
Climate is essential for our environmental problems

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I have an interest in meteorology and was curious about its application to various parts of science.
Because I'm lack of knowledge in this field but it's very important to my research and interest.
Interest in understanding better how our atmosphere works

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes, the course covered all the topics that I was looking for.
Yes
Yes, though I'm not sure I understand all science, but it's been useful.
Yes,

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: It helped to work with a group to prepare for the exams, as there was a lot of material to cover and working with groups enabled us to talk out some of the more challenging concepts.
learn a lot from team mates, though the final cooperation was in a hurry.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: N/A
pay attention to homework. May lose a lot of scores...
If you want to learn, leave some time for the homework!
